title: The Invisible Bumps of the Friendly Skies
text:
From the ground, it’s easy to assume that the sky is just Earth’s wallpaper—a pretty background to our lives that shifts over time but very rarely bothers us. It’s a comforting idea that is rapidly unmasked the first time your coffee sloshes on to your lap just as the captain warns everyone to fasten their seat belts. When a plane hits turbulence, the sudden juddering can be frightening and uncomfortable. But it’s also a reminder that our mostly invisible atmosphere is in motion all the time, whether we can see it or not.

description: The atmosphere looks clear, but it’s actually in motion all the time—as airplane turbulence shows.
